Text: Who am I?
Answer: I am a government employee. I do my job, and I do it well. I am on the side of order and I fight chaos, literally and figuratively. I am one of the few people in my country licensed to kill.

Text:
Who is important
to me?
Answer: The people who protect and support me are important. Miss Moneypenny, Felix, Q, and M are all important to me.

Text:
What do I
need to know?
Answer: I have no idea what I would do if I didn't do what I do. The question makes no sense to me.

Text:
What do I want
to do?
Answer: This is a colossally stupid question. I want to do what needs to be done, and whether what needs to be done is something I want to do is irrelevant.

Text:
What am I
grateful for and
how do I
give thanks?
Answer: I am grateful for the opportunity to serve and the trust my government has in me to make the right decisions; even life and death ones.

Text:
What does
fairness mean
to me?
Answer: Fairness is a fairy tale and I am the fairy.

Text:
Where do
the things I want
come from?
Answer: All the material things I need come from the government; everything I need to do my job and enough pay so I don't care about money.

Text:
What will I do
only if
I am rewarded and
what will I do
for its own sake?
Answer: If you want to know why I do what I do it is because I was trained to do it and it needs to be done. I don't care about rewards. People who care about rewards can be bought, and I can't be bought.

Text:
Who is
the boss of me?
Answer: I am the boss of me. Period.

Text:
Who would help me
even though
they don't like me?
Answer: I have no family. My boss and those who support me in my work would help me even when they don't like me.

Text:
What is
my relationship
with nature?
Answer: I've never thought about it.

Text:
What do
I give without
expectation of return?
Answer: I live to serve. Is that not generosity enough?

Text:
What experiences
do I want
to have?
Answer: I want to live well and live long but not so long that I can no longer do my job.

Text:
What does
friendship mean
to me?
Answer: I have very few friends. Being a friend either means that you support me or you play with me.

Text:
What is my attitude
with respect to
problems, trust,
change and risk?
Answer: Problems are solvable or they shouldn't be called problems. Trusting others is dangerous; there are a very few people I trust without question because if I doubted their loyalty I couldn't do my job. Change generally is for the worse; I prefer stability, but change does grant me the opportunity to manipulate others because when things change people don't know what the new rules are. Every day carries an element of risk. My days might be riskier than yours, but being alive carries risk.

Text:
What do I
produce and
for whom?
Answer: I provide a service more than a traditional product, but you could say I produce order and stability.

Text:
What do I value
and why?
Answer: I value trustworthiness, loyalty, competency, and endurance because it is so very rare.

Text:
What does community mean
to me?
Answer: My most important community are those in my organization that support me and keep me alive, and the second most important is my country for she gives me a reason to do what I do.

Text:
What do I need
and what
is needed of me?
Answer: Others need me to preserve order and when I need help I either get it or I improvise. What I don't need is to hear your opinion of what I do.

Text:
How do I
return the nvestment
made in me?
Answer: I return the investment made in training me by doing my job well.

Text:
What am I
doing to develop
better habits?
Answer: I practice and stay in shape.

Text:
When must I
judge others and
when must I
reserve judgment?
Answer: Judging others is a very important part of my job. People who say you shouldn't judge others are idiots. They lack judgment.

Text:
Am I
blaming leaders for
things that could be
my responsibility?
Answer: I blame incompetent leaders for their incompetence. But that's their problem, not mine.

Text:
Why do I
want to lead?
Answer: I have no interest in leading others because that would mean taking responsibility for them. You worry about you and I'll worry about me.

Text:
Do I choose to
be good knowing
that in order to
avoid being evil
I might do things
people will
not like?
Answer: I am a force for good, and I choose to be good even if people hate me. I am willing to be nice if it gets me what I want but I don't care if others like me or despise me.

Text:
How will I
be good when
everyone else
is evil?
Answer: I trust that my country and my people are good and I worry about whenever everyone else is being evil.

Text:
How might I
benefit from
more knowledge
and when will I
know enough
to act?
Answer: I try my best to learn everything I need to know before I need to know it, but in my line of work, when it is time to act there is no time to do anything but act. He who hesitates is lost, literally.

Text:
What rewards can
I put off until later
so I can concentrate
on doing my
best work now?
Answer: Since I can't be bought, I don't need rewards, now or later. When there is a job to do I do it, and when there isn't a job to do I take what I like.

Text:
How can I
become more
physically, mentally,
and spiritually
healthy?
Answer: I'm pretty physically healthy. Some think I'm mentally ill, but they couldn't do half the things I do without going crazy.

Text:
How can I
make the world
a better place?
Answer: I reduce the level of chaos in the world.

Text:
Do I have
what I need
for the future?
Answer: I wish you hadn't asked me that because now I realize I don't have something to do in the years between when I'm too old to do what I do and when I die.

Text:
When do I need
more power
and why?
Answer: When my enimies are more powerful then I need to become more powerful in order to defeat them.

Text:
Can I think
mathematically,
verbally, and
emotionally?
Answer: Well enough. It hasn't killed me yet.

Text:
How am I influenced
by other people?
Answer: I'm not.

Text:
What questions
am I failing
to ask?
Answer: Now that you ask, I realize I've never thought about who will be my successor and how I might train him or her.

Text:
How can I
be more successful
in the market
for who I am?
Answer: I doubt I could be more successful. I'm at the top of my game.

Text:
What are my
better attributes?
Answer: Loyalty, competency, endurance, and - quite frankly - I'm good looking and very charming.

Text:
Who do I love,
how, and why?
Answer: That's none of you damn business.

Text:
What gets me up
every morning?
Answer: What a stupid question. It's what you do each day, you get up and do what needs to be done.

Text:
What do I love
to do?
Answer: I love the chase; the game; the excitement; and the women.

Text:
Can I, will I,
and do I
forgive myself
and others?
Answer: If I do my job right there is nobody left that needs to be forgiven.

Text:
Can I undersand
what others
feel, think and do
even when I
don't like them?
Answer: If I can't can't get into someone else's head then I can't win against them. I'll tell you, there is nobody else I'd want to be, that's for sure.

Text:
How will I
resist the forces
of chaos?
Answer: That's precisely my job; I resist the forces of chaos.

Text:
How can I
get others to
want me to
meet their needs?
Answer: When my eneimies are more powerful then I need to become more powerful in order to defeat them.

Text:
What has been my
story so far and
what kind of
experiences have I
set myself up
to have?
Answer: It's been a grand adventure so far and I'm going to keep going as long as I can. But if when I get too old they give me a desk job then I'm going to blow my brains out.

Text:
How can I
be of service
to mankind?
Answer: I am of service to mankind because the people I deal with are a treat to us all.

Text:
What invented
stories are useful in
making sense of
the world?
Answer: You might think the story of my life was made up, but that's bull. Fairy tales are for children. The world might be grim, but it's not one of Grim's fairy tales.

Text:
When will I
put myself at risk
for the benefit
of others?
Answer: When I'm on the job I put myself at risk nearly every day, and believe me, I don't do it for the money.

Text:
Am I
who I say I am?
Answer: I absolutely am who I say I am, except when I'm deceiving others, which is a big part of my job.

Text:
Who holds me
accountable?
Answer: My boss holds me accountable. The government holds me accountable. Bostly my enemies hold me accountable because if I don't do my job well they might kill me.

Text:
How will I
become more
knowledgeable, skilled
and wise?
Answer: Generally, before an assignment I'm told what I need to know, and when I discover I need to know something later there is a whole organization that helps me find out.

Text:
What are the
rules that I live by
and do I do
what I say
I will do?
Answer: I always make sure I have a way out. I don't show weakness. I never let them see me bleed. I do what I say I will do and I sleep very well at night.

Text:
Is doing
what I
am doing
worth
my time?
Answer: Absolutely. There are certain jobs that just need to be done and I'm the right person to them.

Text:
Why do
I do
what
I do?
Answer: I dont' know what else I would do. I would be medioocre at anything else.
